messages: b8ef45c094bcf9700b9fcce8cbbf13dc (03:21): (@nuge: sorry, I was afk. I have no issues now, but it is nice to know what my options are when I encounter them.)
1c1df3b0caf6afbdd4244a2b3ef84f1a (03:30): Is there any kind of signal emitted when the top level window focus changes?
1c1df3b0caf6afbdd4244a2b3ef84f1a (03:30): QApplication has no such thing
1c1df3b0caf6afbdd4244a2b3ef84f1a (03:31): it has something for widget focus
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (03:38): yes, just reimplement event() or focusInEvent()/focusOusEvent() in your QMainWindow
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (03:38): or you can install an object filter

ea3f8a0223777fdf8d12983027629f14 (03:42): nuge: [event filter] You can create a custom object to receive all the events received by another QObject: http://doc.trolltech.com/4.1/qobject.html#installEventFilter
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (03:47): !forget #qt event filter
ea3f8a0223777fdf8d12983027629f14 (03:47): nuge: The operation succeeded.

7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (03:47): !learn #qt event filter as You can create a custom object to receive all the events received by another QObject: http://doc.trolltech.com/latest/qobject.html#installEventFilter
ea3f8a0223777fdf8d12983027629f14 (03:47): nuge: The operation succeeded.

b8ef45c094bcf9700b9fcce8cbbf13dc (03:54): Ok, still a complaint left: when I use a painter to draw on a printer, I get a different result then when I paint on a picture, then draw the picture an the printer. Why?
b8ef45c094bcf9700b9fcce8cbbf13dc (03:54): (Specifically, the picture is a different size.)
b8ef45c094bcf9700b9fcce8cbbf13dc (03:55): From what I read in the docs, drawPicture doesn't change the viewport or anythin.
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (03:55): is it *very* different?
b8ef45c094bcf9700b9fcce8cbbf13dc (03:56): I'm making a bit mess, but at the very least the size is different.

b8ef45c094bcf9700b9fcce8cbbf13dc (03:57): Resolution is reported as 1200 DPI, the viewport of the painter is 9600x12800, the QPicture's width() is 170, yet it covers a much larger part of the page than it should.
b8ef45c094bcf9700b9fcce8cbbf13dc (03:57): Drawing directly gives (as expected) a very small picture on a big empty sheet.

b8ef45c094bcf9700b9fcce8cbbf13dc (03:59): (By directly I mean: painter.begin(&printer); my_paint_func(painter); painter.end(); -- the indirect version looks like this: QPicture picture; painter.begin(&picture); my_paint_func(painter); painter.end(); painter.begin(&printer); painter.drawPicture(QPoint(0, 0), picture); painter.end()
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (04:00): my_paint_func doesn't do any scaling of its own?
b8ef45c094bcf9700b9fcce8cbbf13dc (04:01): No, not at all. Just paints a bunch of rectangles and some text.
b8ef45c094bcf9700b9fcce8cbbf13dc (04:01): Or are there functions that modify the viewport/transformation matrix implicitely?
b8ef45c094bcf9700b9fcce8cbbf13dc (04:01): (Apart from obvious ones like translate, rotate, etc...)
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (04:02): i don't think so
b8ef45c094bcf9700b9fcce8cbbf13dc (04:05): Let's see if I can create an isolate testcase.
9b1de629bda4283a6f201aa2ff136911 (04:10): i'd like to create a popupmenu containing not only actions, but also a qslider using the latest qt4.2 snapshot. Is this possible somehow?
99dee0f62b886967d41573a5e6b09309 (04:15): I am trying to do ftp->rawCommand("dir -R");
99dee0f62b886967d41573a5e6b09309 (04:15): but I get error (Unknown command)
99dee0f62b886967d41573a5e6b09309 (04:16): Any body know what is the problem ?
2ca2955dd74a7c1353609e3dc9afc5bd (04:19): Your server doesn't support dir? ;)
99dee0f62b886967d41573a5e6b09309 (04:20): I am trying on ftp.trolltech.com
99dee0f62b886967d41573a5e6b09309 (04:21): Dir command works fine when using ftp client
ea3f8a0223777fdf8d12983027629f14 (04:22): 'Soultaker' pasted "Qt Printer Bug": http://qtnode.net/pastebin/1223
b8ef45c094bcf9700b9fcce8cbbf13dc (04:23): There's my test case. Any ideas?
1c1df3b0caf6afbdd4244a2b3ef84f1a (04:24): kernelpanic: I doubt it. Your best shot would probably creating a popup menu 'manually', though i'd question what a slider is doing in a popup menu
1c1df3b0caf6afbdd4244a2b3ef84f1a (04:24): sounds very non-standard.

9b1de629bda4283a6f201aa2ff136911 (04:26): Cerulean: I *thought* i had read something on qt 4.2 being able to put any widget into a popupmenu (some kdeveloper blog?), but I can't find it now. Don't worry, you're not going to have to use whatever I code :)
b8ef45c094bcf9700b9fcce8cbbf13dc (04:26): (Nuge: any comments/ideas?)
1c1df3b0caf6afbdd4244a2b3ef84f1a (04:27): kernelpanic: Check the 4.2 docs possibly? Haven't heard that
1c1df3b0caf6afbdd4244a2b3ef84f1a (04:27): if you really want to you could just write your own 'popup' using a frameless dialog
9b1de629bda4283a6f201aa2ff136911 (04:29): sounds complicated :(
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (04:33): Soultaker: sorry, no
b8ef45c094bcf9700b9fcce8cbbf13dc (04:33): :/
7780ad7003f15ffc3b31177513eac4f9 (04:33): maybe try qtcentre
ea3f8a0223777fdf8d12983027629f14 (04:33): nuge: [qtcentre] Qt community site: http://qtcentre.org
b8ef45c094bcf9700b9fcce8cbbf13dc (04:33): I think I'll report it as a bug then.
b8ef45c094bcf9700b9fcce8cbbf13dc (04:45): Ah, it's not a bug: "QPicture runs in the default system dpi, and scales the painter to match differences in resolution depending on the window system."
b8ef45c094bcf9700b9fcce8cbbf13dc (04:45): Should have read the docs more carefully.
b8ef45c094bcf9700b9fcce8cbbf13dc (04:46): (I thought QPicture apparently modifies the painter's transformation matrix behind my back.)
